name: MDMA-Assisted Psychotherapy
summary: MDMA-assisted psychotherapy combines the empathogenic compound MDMA with structured psychotherapy to address PTSD, depression, and other conditions. Clinical trials suggest significant benefits, particularly in treatment-resistant PTSD.
description: 3,4-Methylenedioxymethamphetamine (MDMA) is a psychoactive compound known for its empathogenic and prosocial effects. In clinical settings, MDMA is paired with psychotherapy to facilitate trauma processing, emotional openness, and reduction of fear responses. Research, particularly through MAPS-sponsored trials, has demonstrated robust efficacy for severe, treatment-resistant PTSD. MDMA-assisted psychotherapy is being investigated for depression, social anxiety, and substance use disorders. It is currently in late-stage clinical development and under FDA review.

intervention_types: MDMA-assisted psychotherapy (medium-high dose sessions with therapeutic support)
delivery_methods: Oral MDMA administration in supervised clinical setting
metadata.equipment_required: Therapy space, monitoring equipment for vitals
treatment_duration: Typically 2–3 MDMA sessions with preparatory and integration therapy
metadata.regulatory_status: Schedule I controlled substance in most jurisdictions; FDA Breakthrough Therapy designation for PTSD

clinical_metadata.safety_profile: Well-tolerated under clinical supervision. Risks include transient anxiety, elevated blood pressure/heart rate, and rare potential for misuse outside medical settings.
clinical_metadata.evidence_level: Strong Phase II and Phase III RCTs (MAPS) with large effect sizes for PTSD.
clinical_metadata.research_support: MAPS (Multidisciplinary Association for Psychedelic Studies) leading global trials; FDA and EMA reviewing for approval.

items: Exploratory: depression, social anxiety, substance use

sections.text: MDMA primarily increases release of serotonin, norepinephrine, and dopamine while promoting oxytocin and prolactin release. It reduces amygdala hyperreactivity and enhances fear extinction, empathy, and trust, facilitating effective trauma processing in psychotherapy.

sections.preparation: 3 preparatory therapy sessions focusing on trust, safety, and trauma history.
procedure: Oral administration of MDMA (75–125 mg, with optional booster) in a supportive environment

long_term: Improved functioning and quality of life

special_considerations: Requires therapist dyad trained in MAPS protocol

studies: Mitchell JM et al., MDMA-assisted therapy for severe PTSD: phase 3 trial (Nature Medicine, 2021)
MAPS-sponsored phase 2 and phase 3 trials with high response and remission rates
sections.limitations: Requires controlled environments, long-term safety data still accruing

sections.typical_session_cost: Not yet commercially available; projected several thousand USD per session
sections.cost_effectiveness: Potentially cost-saving compared to lifelong PTSD treatment

items.label: Mitchell JM et al., 'MDMA-assisted therapy for severe PTSD: a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled phase 3 study', Nature Medicine (2021)
